# init(_:_:background:)

**Initializer**

Creates a launch scene for document-based applications with a title, a set of actions, and a background.

## Declaration

```swift
nonisolated init(_ title: some StringProtocol, @ViewBuilder _ actions: () -> Actions, @ViewBuilder background: () -> some View)
```

## Parameters

- **title**: A string to use for the view title.
- **actions**: A view builder for returning the view’s actions.
- **background**: The background of the scene.

## Discussion

Use a `DocumentGroupLaunchScene` alongside any [doc://com.apple.SwiftUI/documentation/SwiftUI/DocumentGroup] scenes. If you don’t implement a `DocumentGroup` in the app declaration, you can get the same design by implementing a [doc://com.apple.SwiftUI/documentation/SwiftUI/DocumentLaunchView].
title: init(_:_:background:)
